data.title: New Mexico in Focus; 342; Doug Turner and Allen Weh
data.meta_description:
Doug Turner & Allen Walsh
Early voting is now underway in the June Primaries. New Mexico in Focus
continues our conversations with the state’s gubernatorial candidates. This
week, Correspondent Gwyneth Doland sits down with republican hopefuls Doug
Turner and Allen Weh. Find out what they think about the economy, public
safety, immigration reform, and their chances of going up against Diane
Denish in the general election. Also, on the show this week, how cities are
handling the ongoing budget struggles. Mayors and representatives from
Albuquerque, Santa Fe, and Rio Rancho talk about making tough financial
decisions and how they’re working together to create new jobs. Then, our
Line panelists weigh in on President Obama’s nominee to the Supreme Court,
potential strife in the state Republican Party, and a massive jet fuel leak
under Kirtland Air Force Base. Guests: Gene Grant (Host), Gwyneth Doland
(NMiF Correspondent and Editor, New Mexico Independent), Doug Turner
(Republican Gubernatorial Candidate), Allen Weh (Republican Gubernatorial
Candidate), Richard Berry (Albuquerque Mayor), Tom Swisstack (Rio Rancho
Mayor), and Kate Noble (Santa Fe Economic Development Department).
Panelists: Sophie Martin (Managing Editor, DukeCityFix.com), Jim Scarantino
(Editor, New Mexico Watchdog), Richard Romero (Former Senate President Pro
Tem, Albuquerque), and Arthur Alpert (ABQJournalWatch.com).
